notes:
July 26:
PHONE CALL TO DR KEN MORGAN

(I called Dr Morgan.  Got his voice mail, which features several seconds of dead air instead of his name.  Gave him a new voice mail number for me.)

July 26:
VOICE MAIL FROM DR KEN MORGAN

Voice mail received from 832-283-2292. 



Transcript:

Yeah Mr Johnson this is Dr Ken Morgan
uh I just received your message
uhhhhh could you give me a call
(unintelligible)
after receive this message
This is Dr Ken in Houston Texas
Thank you
and bye for now.

July 26:
PHONE CALL WITH DR KEN MORGAN


Got a phone card and a pay phone.

Had a contentious call with Dr Ken.  He has poor listening skills. He wasn't really sure where the boxes were to be delivered (of course, they aren't to be delivered).  

At the start of the call he wasn't giving his name until I told him mine.  He did not appear to be fully aware of the script he was supposed to follow.

About 60 seconds in, his phone beeped - I'm fairly sure it was Johnson Konah calling in on a second line. He flashed over to it for about 30 seconds then came back on and was more on script.

His story: He is a diplomat.  He used his diplomatic passport to keep the boxes from being inspected at the Houston airport but now needs $2500 for an inspection waiver. He said I can't claim the boxes because they are under his passport.  He can't pay the fee because he's just a poor salaried diplomat.  (And besides, the fee doesn't exist.) He needs me to send him the $2500.

Fine, I said, we will go together.  I will meet you at the storage company. What is the name of the company?  It's attached to the Houston airport, he said. Fine, what is its name?  He didn't know.  I got pissed off - How could you leave my consignment at a storage company and not get the name of it?  Do you have a phone number for it?  

His phone beeped, probably Johnson calling in again. When he flashed over to it I hung up on him.  Total call length was 7 minutes, 40 seconds.



(
Urgent email sent off to Johnson Konah:
)

July 27:
PHONE CALL WITH DR KEN MORGAN


I placed another phone call to Dr Ken Morgan.  I was so pleasant he thought I was a different victim at first.

He asked for the $2500 to be sent to:

JAMES NGUYEN
1800 AIRPORT BLVD 
HOUSTON, TX 77079

He spelled all of that out, painfully slowly.  

He asked that that payment go via Western Union.  He did not know how to pronounce "Nguyen" correctly.  He stated that Mr Nguyen is an accountant with the security company, then changed and stated he is the cash management officer.

I asked where he was staying in Houston. He stated that his son met him at the airport and he can lodge there as long as needed.  I asked how he would deliver the boxes.  He said he will bring the boxes to me via airplane as soon as the waiver is paid and the boxes are claimed from the security company.  The boxes are stored under his diplomatic passport but he needs me to pay for the waiver.  He said that when they landed the inspection people wanted to open the boxes but he would not let them - but he does not know what is in the boxes - so that is why the waiver fee is needed.  I told him my partner will send him $5000.

He now calls it a security company; yesterday he referred to it as a storage company.



(Going back into highly frustrating mode:)

July 27
VOICE MAIL FROM JOHNSON HAMSON

Voice mail received.

Received a phone call from Johnson Konah in Abidjan
Voice mail saved as a WAV file

Transcript:

Hello Johnson S......
please this is uh Johnson uh your partner from Abidjan
Cote d'Ivoire
Please I've been trying to get you online
and um uh I'm begging you please to help me receive
the consignment
with Dr Ken Morgan because he's already there in
America
Please (unclear) help me
I do not know how I don't give you a mail (unclear) in
your mail
please try for me 
and do not allow the consignment to sit too long.
Thank you


(Time to write more obtusely.  I just can't stick to
their script.)

7/28
VOICE MAIL FROM DR KEN MORGAN
Another voice mail received from Dr Ken.  

Transcript:

Yeah Mr Johnson this is Dr Ken the diplomat
ummm I need you to call me as soon as you receive this
message
The number is 0832 283 2292 
Thank you
In case you're wondering, that's what numbers in Abidjan Cote d'Ivoire look like - they start with a 0.  Old habits die hard.

messages.subject: I know what you said but !!!!!!!
messages.body:
Dear Johnson,
 
I thank you for your mail and I do understand that I already knows you before contacting you but bear this in mind that since we have decided to do this business together as partner there are so many things we both need to know of one another so that we can build up good trust and confidence since we are partners  as such,I need to be able to see your picture by so doing I would have known you, your age,working or surdent if working the nature of what you do for the company or if you are the owner, married or single what you like and dislike, things like that is enough so that I can know an say the person I am trusting all this money into his care or custody with out meeting the person before.

I hope you understand why now but if you still say know we can go along all we need do is to undertake a partner ship agreement to stand for us when we recieves the money so that our sharing will be so peaceful and it will be according to our agreement.
 
I will need your telephone and fax number too.
 
Do have a nice day.
 
Yours sincerely.
 
Johnson.
 


(That was such an intensely stupid reply that I decided - unsuccessfully - to pull the plug. But don't worry, he didn't appear to read it.

Off the scale on the prude-o-meter.  But stay with it, it gets much much better.)

("oga" is the 419er term for their gang managers.)

messages.subject: What  you are required to do to claim your
messages.body:
consignment. 

ATTN : Johnson S......,

We acknowledge an application request by Johnson Lamine, demanding from this security company to either ferry your consignment or you come down to this country Cote d' Ivoire the capital city been Abidjan as may be demanded, but to put all these in action we have to get the approval from the Federal Ministry of Justice here in Abidjan.

We therefore ask you to produce this needed proffs by Documents that will back the consignment up, the deliver of your consignment will be effected immediately when all the protocols are completed. 

The security company is ready to attend to you. So you can now call me on the phone number you are having with you.

Following the application by Johnson Lamine, I got to know that you do not have the full documents to claim your fund, this I was able to investigate and got to know that from the four documents needed you only have  two and that is :

1.Certificate of agreement

2.Deposite Agreement

3.The receipt of payment

This below two item must be gotten and they are :

A. CHANGE OF OWNERSHIP CERTIFICATE AND

B.AFFIDAVITE OF CLIAM

Must be gotten by you in order to claim your consignment.

To get this documents needed, from the Federal Ministry of Justice,here in Abidjan and if you will be coming in person  we will need to have a scan copy of your driving license or first and second page of your international passport but if you are not coming down to this country a special diplomatic arrangement will be made to ship the consignment to you via Diplomatic  Air Cargo but that will be under special arrangement.

From our inquire by the head of our legal department barrister Davis Ike, we are told that, to obtain the two documents which must be sign, seal and stamp dutied, that each of the document will cost 1,600 euro for each and because you need two of such documents that means you will need  3,200 euro and because the change of ownership will be notarize in the Notary office to the public , you are required to  pay for the registration of the documents. To get two of the document it therefore means that you will need $3,200 plus $200 for the registration of the documents, the documents must be obtain so that we can effect the transfer of your consignment, immediately we received this documents/the money for the documents we will proceed.

You can send the money directly to the lawyer that will get the document for you through Western Union Money Transfer so that he can pick it and order for the Documents immediately.

Here are the informations to use in sending the money through western union money transfer and email me back the controls numbers.

Name : Davis Ike 

City : Abidjan

Country : Cote D' Ivoire
 
I will be waiting for your call my number is
+225-0552-4057.

Regards. 

Rev. Dr Akoto Martin. 



(Oh dear. Who the *&(! is "Johnson Lamine"?  My contact is supposed to be Johnson Edward Hamson, brother of Janet.  Let's ride with that error for now.)

messages.body:
Johnson,

I hope you and Janet had a wonderful weekend.  I see from your message that you have much to learn about business so it is fortunate indeed that you have sought my counsel.

First, your title says you need money for documents. This is silly.  There is no reason to pay anybody until they actually do work for you. They should provide you with a invoice.

Second, I do not understand your comment about the bank not transferring money without paying the cost of the transfer.  This is what banks do.  There is no cost to transfer money.

I am concerned that whoever is advising you - this Davis Ike guy or the Akoto Martin person - is lying to you and trying to steal your money.  I will not let that happen! Tell then to stop telling you bizarre stories and start doing their jobs!  If you need someone to come of there and physically put a boot up their asses to get them to do their jobs, that can be arranged.  If they cannot do their jobs then get someone else!

Money talks - and if they don't start working, we walk!

Johnson
 
(He wants me to listen to him now.  "Clearifications" from another account.)

messages.body:
Johnson, 

I know you are just a young man and not a businessman so I forgive your tone of voice in your letter.
 
But you should understand I am extremely frustrated with Dr Ken Morgan. I misplaced the paper that had the information about who I was supposed to send a WU to, and he has refused to tell me it. Now how the hell am I supposed to send money to someone without knowing the name?  So I asked him to call me with that information and did he?  DID HE?  NO!  So if you want to rant at someone call him up and rant at him. How can I send money without having the right information?  He never called back with the information! 

This would have been done DAYS ago if Dr Ken Morgan had just given me the bank account information for a transfer.  It sounds like that is a surprise to you but again you don't have experience in American business.  It would have been done immediately.  I could have ordered the transfer OVER THE PHONE and BOOM the money would be there.  No delays like this, no sitting by the phone waiting for Dr Ken Morgan to finally decide to tell me where to send the money.  You say it takes days and weeks to get money out of an account - what would make you think that?  Banks would go out of business if that were the case here.  Maybe that is the way it works in Abidjan but not here. 

It would be DONE.  It's the way business is done.  I tell you I have never used Western Union in my life.  I do not know ANYONE who has EVER used Western Union.  Why not?  Because checks and account transfers are reliable and fast.  But I have acceded to that request.  I am willing to try it. It would be much more efficient to transfer the funds via accounts, and almost as efficient to FedEx a check.  If Dr Ken Morgan ever gets around to responding to my SIMPLE and POLITE request, perhaps I will know where to send it. 

I await his call with the information.  I hope he does not delay further.
 
My mother's condition is dire, we are counting out her last days.  Thank you for asking. 

Be well my friend,
Johnson

messages.body:
Johnson,

Phones are not permitted in the intensive care unit of this hospital (C...... Community Hospital).  This is standard practice in US hospitals.  I have tried repeatedly during the few chances I have to make outbound calls to call Dr Ken Morgan but I only get his voice mail or it just rings and rings.  I've talked to him three times out of about a dozen attempts.  How many voice mails am I supposed to leave him with the same questions???

I have NO IDEA why Dr Ken Morgan is incapable of leaving detailed instructions on a voice mail.

I asked about the Western Union destination because I remembered the guy's name was something like Nguyen but I did not have his full name or his address that Dr Morgan had said.  It's been a hectic week here, trying to run my office remotely.  The paper's probably in the hotel room but I have been sleeping at the hospital.  So that's what I needed, the right name and address for Nguyen.  Then you said Alvarez. But now it sounds like Dr Morgan is the right person.

Do you see why I am confused?  Dr Morgan could clear up this confusion with one phone call or one email.

I will be heading back to DC by Monday morning at the latest.  Because of my schedule there I may need to hand off the sending of this fund to my administrative assistant as I will be running a board meeting and planning my company's next acquisitions.  If I don't hear from Dr Morgan today to settle this confusion then I am sorry to say that it would seem like he does not want this transaction to complete while I am here.  I don't know why. Should I plan to meet with him face to face?  Maybe that would jolt him into action.

My mother is faring poorly.  She is going in for surgery in about an hour. We're all exhausted.

Be well my friend,
Johnson.

messages.body:
July 30
PHONE CALL WITH DR KEN MORGAN

Called Dr Ken Morgan.  Had a contentious phone call that lasted 16:50.

I started by saying "I have been trying to send the money to you but I got three different answers about who to send it to.  There's too much at stake and I need the right name."

He said I was just playing games.

He asked about the three names, I said they were Nguyen, Alvarez, and Morgan. He said that Alvarez and Nguyen worked together and I should send it to Alvarez.

I said I had asked my administrative assistant to send the money but the address for Alvarez was incorrect.  He said that the street name should be GULF FREEWAY, not GULS FREEWAY.

He accused me of being a problem and investigating him.  He said that Western Union does not need addresses.  I said that my admin assistant had tried to send it but it was not sent because the address was wrong.

I pointed out that he did not leave detailed information in his voice mails as I had requested.

He started stumbling, asking if I thought he was going to steal the money (he brought this up without prompting).  "$2500 is not enough to change a person's life, we are not talking about $2.5 million, what is important is getting the boxes.  I am not a criminal." - exact quote.

I said I was upset about the delay and did not understand why we did not do a check via FedEx or a bank transfer, it would have been done in seconds instead of all this delay.

I asked for the company name to send the money to, he said that is not a required field for WU, he sends money all the time to Africa and all over the world with no company name.  I said I wasn't trying to send money to Africa, I am trying to send it to Houston.

He insulted me, said I was delaying things.  I got ticked off and told him that if he had answered my questions the first time the money would have been sent.  He said that since my administrative assistant works under me I should just order him to send the money.

I told him to come to Washington DC with the boxes. He asked for an address.  I said I would meet him at the embassy on Monday afternoon.

"What embassy?" he asked.

"The Ivory Coast embassy in Washington, DC.  You're a diplomat with them so let's meet there."

He said that if the transfer came through he would be there with the boxes.  He did not know the address for his alleged embassy.

I closed by telling him that he has not been behaving professionally and I expect him to start behaving like a professional.

messages.body:
Johnson,

Good news!  Dr Ken FINALLY gave me the transfer information.  He said the street name you gave me was incorrect.  It was supposed to be Gulf Freeway, not GULSFREEWAY as you wrote.  As for Dr Ken, honestly I don't know what that man's problem is.  He is VERY unprofessional and VERY rude. But I guess we are stuck with him (for now) but I would advise you not to deal with such a rude person in the future.  As you will discover, there are PLENTY of diplomats in the world to choose from.  This guy is insulting and rude and not worthy of you.  I was at a party last week with a delegation of diplomats from Asia and they were the most polite people I have ever met.  This Morgan guy on the other hand...he seems to think he is my boss or something.  And any boss who acted like him would be fired.

Anyway, I have forwarded the corrected address to my admin assistant.  He is a stickler for details so I am sure when something is done it will be done correctly.  My assistant had said that the WU slip asked for a company name. Dr Ken REFUSED to provide it.  I have NO IDEA why he would not tell me the name of the company - again, more unprofessional behavior.  They're our boxes, not his.  If his failure to provide that information causes a problem it'll be on Dr Ken's head.

Dr Ken said he will be in DC on Monday afternoon.  He is to meet me at the Ivory Coast embassy there.  If you talk to him give him the address.  He didn't seem to know it when we talked.  It is: 2424 Massachusetts Avenue, NW, Washington DC 20008. That's along what is known as "Embassy Row" in DC.

I will be there at 4 PM on Monday awaiting him. If he gets lost along the way, he can call them at 202-###-####.

As you know I will be spending the earlier portion of the day at the burial.

I look forward to having great news to tell you Monday night.

Blessings to you and Janet,
Johnson

Johnson,

I am worried for you, I hope you are okay.  My prayers are with you.  I am not sure who you are talking about me contacting or why. I am worried that you may have gone into business with some criminal.

I'd like to send you a small token, say 10 thousand, to allow you to get over this hump and your present difficulties and you and Janet can come join me here.  BUT FIRST I need to be sure you are truly honourable.  So I have a small test that you can easily pass. Once this is done I will be sure you are an honourable Christian.

I support a mission church in Abidjan.  To show me that you are truly an honourable man, I simply ask that you give a small donation of $500 to this church. If you do not have that money, borrow it.  As soon as the church notifies me that you have given this small donation, I will send you 10 thousand.  I will send you the 10 thousand through the same church with instructions that it be given to you for your pastoral studies.  In that way there will be no question or issue or tax related to transfer of the money.  I will know when you have given the church the money and I will be sure you will get what I send.

If you give her more than $500 then I will of course send you more than 10 thousand in return - sevenfold, as Jesus said.

Please let me know as soon as you are able give the church the money and I will give you the address for the pastor.

UNKINDLY CONTRIBUTOR to JOHNSON HAMSON

Johnson,

Pastor Chindy copied me on her reply to your email to her.  Is there some reason why you have not done what you promised? Pastor Chindy is waiting for you to give her the money you promised.


It looks to me like you are avoiding her.  Is this how Paul would have behaved?  Even after the riot in Ephesus he continued to reach out to that city because he had pledged himself to do so.  Perhaps you should re-read Acts to familiarize yourself with his perseverence.

By contrast your task is miniscule.  COMPLETE IT AT ONCE!

Finally, you said (as she quoted in her cc'd reply) the following: "please do let me understand this things then we can go into business as you said."

What are you talking about?  There is no business. You are to give her the money and that is the end of that transaction.

I await word from you of your planned completion of this effort tomorrow.

Blessings
Johnson
